Name: API
Docs: API holds functions for the frontend.

Functions.Name: Signup
Functions.Docs:
Signup registers a new account. We send an email for users to verify they
control the email address. If we already have a verified account, we send a
password reset instead.

Functions.Name: SignupEmail
Functions.Docs:
SignupEmail returns the email address for a verify token. So we can show it, and
the user can get prompted for saving full full login credentials by a password
manager after verifying the signup.

Functions.Name: VerifySignup
Functions.Docs:
VerifySignup verifies a new account by checking the token. The token was in the
URL in the signup email.

Functions.Name: UserRemove
Functions.Docs: UserRemove lets a user remove their account.

Functions.Name: Redeem
Functions.Docs:
Redeem turns a login token, as used in login-links in notification emails, into
a session by returning a csrf token and setting a session cookie.

Functions.Name: RequestPasswordReset
Functions.Docs:
RequestPasswordReset requests a password reset. We send an email with a link
with a password reset token.

Functions.Name: ResetPassword
Functions.Docs: ResetPassword resets a password for an account based on a token.

Functions.Name: Prep
Functions.Docs:
Prep helps prevent CSRF calls. It must be called before calling functions like
Login, Subscribe. It returns a token, which it also sets as a samesite cookie.
The subsequent call must pass in the token, and the request must have the cookie
set.

Functions.Name: Login
Functions.Docs:
Login verifies the accounts password and creates a new session, returning a csrf
token that must be present in an x-csrf header in subsequent calls. A same-site
cookie is set too.

Functions.Name: Logout
Functions.Docs: Logout clears the session cookie. It does not invalidate the session.

Functions.Name: Overview
Functions.Docs: Overview returns data needed for the overview page, after logging in.

Functions.Name: SubscribeSet
Functions.Docs:
SubscribeSet changes either meta (service messages) or module updates
subscriptions. If not subscribed, no messages are sent.

Functions.Name: IntervalSet
Functions.Docs: SetInterval sets a new minimum interval between update messages.

Functions.Name: SubscriptionCreate
Functions.Docs: SubscriptionCreate adds a new subscription to a module.

Functions.Name: SubscriptionImport
Functions.Docs:
SubscriptionImport parses a go.mod file and subscribes to all direct and
optionally indirect dependencies.

Functions.Name: SubscriptionSave
Functions.Docs: SubscriptionSave updates an existing subscription to a module.

Functions.Name: SubscriptionRemove
Functions.Docs: SubscriptionRemove removes an existing subscription.

Functions.Name: Home
Functions.Docs: Home returns data for the home page.

Functions.Name: Recents
Functions.Docs: Recents returns more recent packages, currently 150.

Functions.Name: Forward
Functions.Docs:
Forward tries a bit harder to forward the transparency log. While we
periodically fetch the /latest database tree state and forward the log, at
least sum.golang.org only returns new values about once every 10 minutes.
But we can look at the latest additions to index.golang.org and get the most
recently added module from it, then look it up to gets the associated tree
state and forward based on that.

Structs.Name: Subscription
Structs.Docs: Subscription to a module. New versions will cause an Update to be registered and sent.

Fields.Name: Module
Fields.Docs: Full path to subscribe to, e.g. github.com/mjl-. The transparency log can have entries for various upper/lower case variants. Easiest to care only about the canonical name.

Fields.Name: BelowModule
Fields.Docs: If set, we also match module paths that are below the subscribed module.

Fields.Name: OlderVersions
Fields.Docs: If set, we also send updates about added versions that are older than what seen previously. Can happen when multiple tags (versions) are pushed and old ones are fetched later.

Fields.Name: Prerelease
Fields.Docs: No pre-release version, such as "v1.2.3-rc1", or "v1.2.3-0.20240214164601-39bfa4338a12".

Fields.Name: Comment
Fields.Docs: Comment by user, to explain to future self why this is being monitored.

Fields.Name: SubscriptionID
Fields.Docs: No reference, subscriptions may be deleted.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: If 0, not yet sent. We can suppress sending when recent messages have failed, or when our send rate has been too high. Index for enumerating updates that weren't notified about yet.

Structs.Name: UserLog
Structs.Docs: UserLog is a line of history about a change to the user account.

Strings.Name: Interval
Strings.Docs: How often a user wants to receive update notification email messages.
